fr.lirmm.graphik.graal.api.core

Interface Substitution

  • All Superinterfaces:
    AppendableToStringBuilder
    All Known Implementing Classes:
    AbstractSubstitution, FreshVarSubstitution, HashMapSubstitution, TreeMapSubstitution

    public interface Substitution
extends AppendableToStringBuilder
    A substitution is a syntactic transformation of a logical expression. This transformation replace some variables by other terms.
    Author:
    Cl√©ment Sipieter (INRIA) <clement@6pi.fr>

      • compose

        boolean compose(Term term,
              Term substitut)
        The composition of a substitution is more complex that just put an other term substitution. If the current substitution is {X -> Y} and you add a term substitution {Y -> 'a'}, the result is {X -> 'a', Y -> 'a'}. An other example is {X -> 'a'} + {X -> Y} => {Y -> 'a', X -> 'a'}.
        Parameters:
        term -
        substitut -
        Returns:
        false if the composition imply a substitution of a constant term by another constant term, true otherwise.
        Throws:
        SubstitutionException

      • compose

        Substitution compose(Substitution s)
        (const)
        Parameters:
        s -
        Returns:
        null if the composition imply a substitution of a constant term by another constant term, the result of the composition otherwise.
        Throws:
        SubstitutionException
